title: 115_hr2185
content: The "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act" is the short title of the Act. It involves determining if foreign financial institutions have facilitated transactions for covered persons. The President must determine if foreign financial institutions listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons every 180 days for up to 5 years. This is part of the "Iran Sanctions Relief Review Act." The President must determine if foreign financial institutions listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have knowingly facilitated significant transactions for covered persons and transmit certifications to congressional committees. Certifications must be submitted in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. The certification of determinations regarding foreign financial institutions, including Iranian ones, must be submitted in unclassified form with the option of a classified annex. Transactions and financial services are deemed significant based on regulations in title 31, Code of Federal Regulations. SEC. 3. Determination and certification of support for covered persons by certain foreign individuals. The President must determine if foreign persons listed in Attachments 3 or 4 of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action have supported individuals described in section 4 every 180 days for up to 5 years. This is in accordance with the Act passed, with reports to be sent to congressional committees. The President must determine if foreign persons have supported individuals described in section 4 every 180 days for up to 5 years. Reports are to be sent to congressional committees. Determinations must be transmitted to the appropriate congressional committees in unclassified form, with the possibility of a classified annex. SEC. 4. COVERED PERSONS. Covered persons include organizations designated as foreign terrorist organizations by the Secretary of State and foreign individuals whose property is blocked under Executive Orders related to terrorism. The curr_chunk discusses Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with persons who commit, threaten to commit, or support terrorism, as well as the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with persons involved in terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property and prohibiting transactions with persons involved in terrorism and the proliferation of weapons of mass destruction, including orders related to Syria. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property of persons in connection with the national emergency in Syria, including orders related to human rights abuses and senior officials. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property in Syria, including orders related to human rights abuses and senior officials. The curr_chunk lists Executive Orders related to blocking property in Syria, including orders related to human rights abuses and senior officials. Executive Orders mentioned include 13582, 13608, and 13606. The curr_chunk mentions Executive Orders related to blocking property in Iran and Syria, specifically targeting foreign sanctions evaders and individuals involved in grave human rights abuses. The curr_chunk discusses the blocking of property belonging to certain persons in Iran, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk outlines the blocking of property belonging to Iranian persons, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the blocking of property belonging to Iranian persons, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. The curr_chunk defines key terms related to the blocking of property belonging to Iranian persons, including the Revolutionary Guard Corps and its affiliates. In this Act, "appropriate congressional committees," "foreign financial institution," and "foreign person" are defined. The curr_chunk defines a "foreign person" as a non-U.S. individual or entity, excluding foreign financial institutions. The term "foreign person" is defined as a non-U.S. individual or entity, excluding foreign financial institutions. A "foreign terrorist organization" is any group designated as such by the Secretary of State. The term "Iranian financial institution" is defined in relation to the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions, excluding foreign financial institutions. The Secretary of State designated a foreign terrorist organization according to the Immigration and Nationality Act. The term "Iranian financial institution" is defined in the Comprehensive Iran Sanctions Act. The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action was agreed upon in Vienna on July 14, 2015. The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, agreed to in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, was transmitted to Congress by the President on July 19, 2015. The Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action, agreed to in Vienna on July 14, 2015, by Iran and several other countries, was transmitted to Congress on July 19, 2015, along with implementing materials and agreements related to the plan. The term "person" is defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996. According to the Atomic Energy Act of 1954, as amended by the Iran Nuclear Agreement Review Act of 2015, the terms "person" and "United States person" are defined in the Iran Sanctions Act of 1996.
